case_title: NAQEEBULLAH KHAN vs GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Chief Secretary Government of Balochistan, Quetta and 4 others
respondant: Government of Balochistan through Chief Secretary Government of Balochistan, Quetta

accussed_details.name: Private Respondent No.4
allegation: Improper promotion to B-19 without required experience

accussed_details.name: Private Respondent No.5
allegation: Improper promotion to B-19 without required experience

accussed_details.name: Private Respondent No.6
allegation: Improper promotion to B-19 without required experience

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the seniority list of Directors issued in 1999, claiming improper promotions of private respondents Nos.4, 5, and 6 to B-19 without meeting the required experience criteria under the Balochistan Agriculture Department Extension Wing Service Rules, 1983.
investigation_summary: The appellant failed to provide supporting documents for his claims and did not challenge earlier seniority lists or promotion orders within the prescribed time. Respondents Nos.4, 5, and 6 were promoted based on departmental rules and Public Service Commission recommendations.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal dismissed the appeal, citing the appellant's failure to challenge earlier seniority lists and promotion orders within the limitation period. The impugned seniority list was found to be legally valid under Section 8(4) of the Balochistan Civil Servants Act, 1974.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal dismissed with no order as to costs.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued that private respondents lacked the required 18 years of experience in the Extension Wing for promotion to B-19.
Respondents argued that the appellant's claims were barred by time and lacked supporting evidence.
statutes: Balochistan Agriculture Department Extension Wing Service Rules, 1983
sections: Section 8(4) of Balochistan Civil Servants Act, 1974
key_issues: Validity of seniority list issued in 1999
Eligibility criteria for promotion to B-19 under Service Rules, 1983
Bar of limitation in challenging earlier seniority lists and promotion orders

legal_terms.Seniority: The order of precedence among employees based on their rank or length of service.
legal_terms.Bar of Limitation: A legal restriction preventing claims after a certain period.

words_and_phrases.Retrospective Promotion: Promotion granted with effect from a past date.
words_and_phrases.Direct Recruitment: Appointment through a competitive selection process.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the appellant's challenge to the seniority list of Directors issued in 1999, alleging improper promotions of private respondents Nos.4, 5, and 6 to B-19 without meeting the required experience criteria under the Service Rules, 1983. The Tribunal dismissed the appeal, citing the appellant's failure to challenge earlier seniority lists and promotion orders within the prescribed time. The impugned seniority list was found legally valid under Section 8(4) of the Balochistan Civil Servants Act, 1974.
